topic_title: communicate with accuracy and fluency to participate fully in discussions on a variety of topics.
can_do_statement: I can communicate with accuracy and fluency to participate fully in discussions on a variety of topics.

lessons.title: Expressing Opinions and Arguments
lessons.objective: Learners will be able to express nuanced opinions and construct arguments with appropriate supporting evidence.

cards.example_sentence: A mi parecer, la solución a este problema es más compleja.
cards.grammar_explanation: Useful phrase for introducing an opinion.

cards.example_sentence: La economía está mejorando; sin embargo, el desempleo sigue siendo alto.
cards.grammar_explanation: Common conjunction to contrast ideas.

cards.example_sentence: Hubo mucha lluvia; por lo tanto, la cosecha será buena.
cards.grammar_explanation: Signals a conclusion or consequence.

cards.example_sentence: A pesar de las dificultades, seguimos adelante.
cards.grammar_explanation: Introduces a contrasting element.

cards.example_sentence: Es crucial que todos participemos en el debate.
cards.grammar_explanation: Emphasizes the importance of something.

cards.example_sentence: En cuanto a la reforma, todavía hay mucho que discutir.
cards.grammar_explanation: Used to introduce a specific topic.

cards.example_sentence: Según el informe, la situación ha mejorado.
cards.grammar_explanation: Attributes information to a source.

cards.example_sentence: Considerando que no hay tiempo, debemos ser breves.
cards.grammar_explanation: Introduces a reason or condition.

lessons.title: Discussing Social Issues
lessons.objective: Learners will be able to discuss complex social issues with appropriate vocabulary and sensitivity.

cards.example_sentence: La desigualdad social es un problema grave en muchos países.
cards.grammar_explanation: Noun referring to disparities.

cards.example_sentence: El desempleo juvenil es una preocupación constante.
cards.grammar_explanation: Noun referring to joblessness.

cards.example_sentence: La pobreza extrema afecta a millones de personas.
cards.grammar_explanation: Noun indicating a state of being poor.

cards.example_sentence: La defensa de los derechos humanos es fundamental.
cards.grammar_explanation: Basic rights inherent to all human beings.

cards.example_sentence: La discriminación racial es inaceptable.
cards.grammar_explanation: Unjust treatment based on certain characteristics.

cards.example_sentence: El racismo estructural perpetúa la desigualdad.
cards.grammar_explanation: Prejudice, discrimination, or antagonism directed against someone of a different race.

cards.example_sentence: La xenofobia ha aumentado en algunos países debido a la inmigración.
cards.grammar_explanation: Dislike of or prejudice against people from other countries.

cards.example_sentence: El acceso a la educación es un derecho fundamental.
cards.grammar_explanation: Ability to obtain or make use of something.

cards.example_sentence: Es importante abordar estos problemas con seriedad.
cards.grammar_explanation: Verb meaning to deal with a problem.

cards.example_sentence: La justicia social busca la igualdad de oportunidades.
cards.grammar_explanation: Justice in terms of the distribution of wealth, opportunities, and privileges within a society.

lessons.title: Discussing Environmental Issues
lessons.objective: Learners will be able to discuss environmental issues and related policies.

cards.example_sentence: El cambio climático es una amenaza global.
cards.grammar_explanation: Noun referring to long-term shifts in temperatures and weather patterns.

cards.example_sentence: La deforestación contribuye al cambio climático.
cards.grammar_explanation: Noun referring to the clearing of forests.

cards.example_sentence: La sostenibilidad es clave para el futuro del planeta.
cards.grammar_explanation: Noun referring to the ability to be maintained at a certain rate or level.

cards.example_sentence: La energía renovable es una alternativa a los combustibles fósiles.
cards.grammar_explanation: Energy that is collected from renewable resources.

cards.example_sentence: La contaminación del aire es un problema en muchas ciudades.
cards.grammar_explanation: Noun referring to the presence or introduction into the environment of a substance which has harmful or poisonous effects.

cards.example_sentence: La gestión de los recursos naturales es esencial.
cards.grammar_explanation: Materials or substances such as minerals, forests, water, and fertile land that occur in nature and can be used for economic gain.

cards.example_sentence: Debemos proteger el medio ambiente para las futuras generaciones.
cards.grammar_explanation: Verb meaning to keep safe from harm or injury.

cards.example_sentence: Es importante conservar el agua.
cards.grammar_explanation: Verb meaning to protect from harm or destruction.

cards.example_sentence: El calentamiento global causa el derretimiento de los glaciares.
cards.grammar_explanation: A gradual increase in the overall temperature of the earth's atmosphere generally attributed to the greenhouse effect caused by increased levels of carbon dioxide, CFCs, and other pollutants.

cards.example_sentence: Hay que reducir las emisiones de gases de efecto invernadero.
cards.grammar_explanation: The production and discharge of something, especially gas or radiation.

lessons.title: Discussing Economic Issues
lessons.objective: Learners will be able to discuss economic issues such as inflation, trade, and development with appropriate vocabulary.

cards.example_sentence: La inflación ha aumentado los precios de los alimentos.
cards.grammar_explanation: Noun referring to a general increase in prices and fall in the purchasing value of money.

cards.example_sentence: El comercio internacional es crucial para la economía global.
cards.grammar_explanation: The exchange of capital, goods, and services across international borders or territories.

cards.example_sentence: El PIB de este país ha crecido un 3%.
cards.grammar_explanation: A monetary measure of the market value of all the final goods and services produced and sold (not resold) within a country during a specific period.

cards.example_sentence: La globalización ha cambiado la forma en que hacemos negocios.
cards.grammar_explanation: The process by which businesses or other organizations develop international influence or start operating on an international scale.

cards.example_sentence: El desarrollo sostenible busca equilibrar crecimiento y protección ambiental.
cards.grammar_explanation: Development that meets the needs of the present without compromising the ability of future generations to meet their own needs.

cards.example_sentence: La economía está en recesión.
cards.grammar_explanation: A period of temporary economic decline during which trade and industrial activity are reduced, generally identified by a fall in GDP in two successive quarters.

cards.example_sentence: La deuda pública de este país es muy alta.
cards.grammar_explanation: The total debt owed by a country's government.

cards.example_sentence: La inversión extranjera puede impulsar el crecimiento económico.
cards.grammar_explanation: Investment made by a company or entity based in one country, into a company or entity based in another country.

cards.example_sentence: Los aranceles pueden afectar el comercio internacional.
cards.grammar_explanation: A tax or duty to be paid on a particular class of imports or exports.

cards.example_sentence: El gobierno tiene un déficit presupuestario.
cards.grammar_explanation: The amount by which something, especially a sum of money, is too small.

lessons.title: Discussing Political Systems
lessons.objective: Learners will be able to describe and compare different political systems.

cards.example_sentence: La democracia es un sistema de gobierno basado en la voluntad popular.
cards.grammar_explanation: Noun referring to a system of government by the whole population or all the eligible members of a state, typically through elected representatives.

cards.example_sentence: El autoritarismo limita las libertades individuales.
cards.grammar_explanation: Noun referring to the enforcement or advocacy of strict obedience to authority at the expense of personal freedom.

cards.example_sentence: El socialismo busca una distribución más equitativa de la riqueza.
cards.grammar_explanation: A political and economic theory of social organization which advocates that the means of production, distribution, and exchange should be owned or regulated by the community as a whole.

cards.example_sentence: El capitalismo fomenta la competencia y la innovación.
cards.grammar_explanation: An economic and political system in which a country's trade and industry are controlled by private owners for profit, rather than by the state.

cards.example_sentence: El populismo a menudo apela a las emociones del pueblo.
cards.grammar_explanation: A political approach that strives to appeal to ordinary people who feel that their concerns are disregarded by established elite groups.

cards.example_sentence: Las elecciones son un pilar de la democracia.
cards.grammar_explanation: A formal and organized choice by vote of a person for a political office or other position.

cards.example_sentence: El gobierno está implementando nuevas políticas.
cards.grammar_explanation: The system or group of people governing an organized community, often a state.

cards.example_sentence: Los partidos políticos compiten por el poder.
cards.grammar_explanation: An organized group of people with at least roughly similar political aims and opinions, that seeks to influence public policy by getting its candidates elected to public office.

cards.example_sentence: Cada partido político tiene su propia ideología.
cards.grammar_explanation: A system of ideas and ideals, especially one which forms the basis of economic or political theory and policy.

cards.example_sentence: La constitución garantiza los derechos de los ciudadanos.
cards.grammar_explanation: A body of fundamental principles or established precedents according to which a state or other organization is acknowledged to be governed.

lessons.title: Discussing Cultural Trends
lessons.objective: Learners will be able to analyze and discuss current cultural trends.

cards.example_sentence: Las redes sociales tienen un gran impacto en la sociedad.
cards.grammar_explanation: Online platforms used for social networking.

cards.example_sentence: La globalización cultural influye en las costumbres y tradiciones.
cards.grammar_explanation: The transmission of ideas, meanings, and values around the world in such a way as to extend and intensify social relations.

cards.example_sentence: La identidad cultural es importante para preservar las tradiciones.
cards.grammar_explanation: The identity of a group or culture, or of an individual as far as one is influenced by one's belonging to a group or culture.

cards.example_sentence: La diversidad cultural enriquece a las sociedades.
cards.grammar_explanation: The state of being diverse; variety.

cards.example_sentence: La tradición es un conjunto de costumbres y creencias.
cards.grammar_explanation: A custom or belief passed on from generation to generation.

cards.example_sentence: Las tendencias de moda cambian rápidamente.
cards.grammar_explanation: A general direction in which something is developing or changing.

cards.example_sentence: El arte contemporáneo a menudo desafía las convenciones.
cards.grammar_explanation: Art produced at the present period in time.

cards.example_sentence: Los valores culturales influyen en el comportamiento.
cards.grammar_explanation: Principles or standards of behavior; one's judgment of what is important in life.

cards.example_sentence: La innovación es clave para el progreso cultural.
cards.grammar_explanation: The introduction of something new; a new idea, method, or device.

cards.example_sentence: Es importante preservar el patrimonio cultural de cada país.
cards.grammar_explanation: The legacy of physical artifacts and intangible attributes of a group or society that are inherited from past generations, maintained in the present and bestowed for the benefit of future generations.
